channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-5263] xmlTestTriggerWithXMLOperators(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.BasicSetup) fails with java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
item.description:
On the 10.8 branch, xmlTestTriggerWithXMLOperators is failing with revision 1132702 possibly after the following checkin:
DERBY-3870: Concurrent Inserts of rows with XML data results in an exception

Merged fix from trunk (revisions 1101839, 1125305, 1126358, 1127883
and 1132546).

Bumped last digit in version number on the branch so that stored
prepared statements will be invalidated (needed in case they use XML
operators since the format of query plans using those operators has
changed).

It looks like the behavior if the version were not bumped, but it actually was, so not sure what the issue is.

There were 4 errors:
1) xmlTestTriggerWithXMLOperators(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.BasicSetup)java.sql.SQLException: Java exception: 'org/apache/derby/iapi/sql/execute/ResultSetFactory.getBulkTableScanResultSet(Lorg/apache/derby/iapi/sql/Activation;JILorg/apache/derby/iapi/services/loader/GeneratedMethod;ILorg/apache/derby/iapi/services/loader/GeneratedMethod;ILorg/apache/derby/iapi/services/loader/GeneratedMethod;IZ[[Lorg/apache/derby/iapi/store/access/Qualifier;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;ZZIIIZIIZZDD)Lorg/apache/derby/iapi/sql/execute/NoPutResultSet;: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError'.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I am able to reproduce this on both trunk and 10.8 if I run the tests with java.endorsed.dirs pointing to a directory containing the Xalan jars. The errors happen in the post soft upgrade phase with the 10.5.x and 10.6.x versions. Upgrade from earlier or later versions than 10.5/10.6 seems to work fine. Given that it only seems to be a problem with 10.5 and 10.6, I suspect that the root cause is similar to or somehow related to DERBY-4835, which was a problem with trigger plans not getting recompiled after upgrade from 10.5/10.6.

The problem we see probably is DERBY-4835. A similar failure was reported in DERBY-5105 and fixed by disabling testing in the soft upgrade phase for the versions that suffer from DERBY-4835. I think we can fix this failure the same way.

Attaching a patch that disables testing in the post soft upgrade test if the old version suffers from DERBY-4835. All the upgrade tests ran cleanly on 10.8 and trunk with the patch, in an environment that showed the problem without the patch.

Committed to trunk with revision 1132928.
Committed to 10.8 with revision 1132929.

Resolving the issue as "Won't fix" since fixing the actual problem in the already released versions would require time travel. The committed fix just skipped testing the versions that have this problem and didn't address the underlying problem.

If someone comes across this issue in the wild, they can use one of the workarounds outlined in DERBY-5105:

Workaround 1: Reboot the database using Derby 10.7.1.1 or later. Simply connect to the database and then disconnect without doing any other operations. When reverting to the old version again, the triggers should work correctly.

Workaround 2: After reverting to the old version, drop and recreate the affected triggers.
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.
